result.execSummary:
The defendant Brenda L Blucher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: $500 fine plus costs which includes $1,300 buy money.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment as determined by probation agent.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Huber release granted. 60 days to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Brenda L Blucher in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State/Defense still ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. for DNA Sample

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brenda L Blucher in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. State/Defense not requesting a PSI. Atty Clowers requests a sentencing date, defendant would like to get her affairs in order before proceeding to sentencing. State has no objection to putting off sentencing. Sentencing set for 2/15/16 at 2:30 pm. Bond remains in effect.
Motion hearing at 01-11-2016 09:00 am
to suppress statements
State's Motion to Impeach with Evidence of Prior Convictions

Defendant Brenda L Blucher in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, inquires of defense whether matter is proceeding to trial on 1/12/16. Atty Clowers requests an adjournment of trial because of a medical appointment for defendant on same date as jury trial. State objects to adjournment of trial, makes statement. Court indicates this matter will proceed to trial on 1/12/16, matter has been rescheduled twice already. Court indicates this matter is in the #1 position for trial. State indicates they will be filing their standard motion to impeach within the next few days. Bond remains in effect.
Jury trial at 01-12-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Brenda L Blucher in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Clowers asks court to set matter for pretrial and trial. Court will set for pretrial and trial. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Brenda L Blucher appears by phone along with attorney David R. Clowers who appears in person.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Clowers requests a status, needs time to get up to speed on the case. Court questions defendant on phone appearance. Defendant indicates she's having some medical issues.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Status conference set for June 22, 2015 at 11:00. Bond continues as is.

Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds Defendant competent, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial. State will file Information within next couple of days that mirrors the Complaint.

Defendant Brenda L Blucher appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Gerbers indicates he has a conflict, will appoint counsel to represent defendant. State gives incident report, potential charges.
